# How to Automatically De-obfuscate Using DataDog Error Tracking

Last updated December 3, 2024 by Appdome

## What is DataDog Error Tracking?

DataDog is a lightweight, real-time crash reporter that helps you track, prioritize, and fix stability issues that erode your app quality. DataDog saves you troubleshooting time by intelligently grouping crashes and highlighting the circumstances that lead up to them.

## Understanding Stack Trace Obfuscation with Appdome’s Obfuscate App Logic

Before diving into the de-obfuscation process, it’s essential to understand the impact of integrating Appdome’s Obfuscate App Logic with DataDog. This integration results in obfuscated stack traces that are difficult to interpret without the appropriate de-obfuscation keys, thus safeguarding your app’s internal logic by making the stack traces challenging to read without proper de-obfuscation keys.

The following sections of this article will guide you through the steps to automatically de-obfuscate these stack traces, starting with a glimpse at how an obfuscated stack trace looks prior to de-obfuscation.

**Before DataDog de-obfuscation  
![Obfuscated Mapping Files](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/Obfuscated-Mapping-Files.png)**

## Preparing Your App

To start with the de-obfuscation process, your app first needs to be obfuscated using Appdome’s [Obfuscate App Logic](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/mobile-app-security/mobile-code-obfuscation/obfuscate-mobile-business-logic-anti-reversing-in-android-apps/) security features.

## **Prerequisites for Using Appdome’s Obfuscate App Logic Plugins:**

To use Appdome’s mobile app security build system to **Obfuscate App Logic**, you’ll need:

* Appdome account ([**create a free Appdome account here**](https://fusion.appdome.com/signup "https://fusion.appdome.com/signup"))
* A license for **Obfuscate App Logic**
* [**Mobile App**](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/dev-sec-tools/how-appdome-works/begin-no-code-mobile-app-security-project "https://www.appdome.com/how-to/dev-sec-tools/how-appdome-works/begin-no-code-mobile-app-security-project") (.apk or .aab for Android)
* Signing Credentials (see [**Signing Secure Android apps**](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/appsec-release-orchestration/code-signing-protected-android-ios/code-sign-secured-android-apps-in-devsecops-build-system/ "https://www.appdome.com/how-to/appsec-release-orchestration/code-signing-protected-android-ios/code-sign-secured-android-apps-in-devsecops-build-system/") and [**Signing Secure iOS apps**](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/appsec-release-orchestration/code-signing-protected-android-ios/appdome-enabling-signing-secured-ios-apps-without-xcode/ "https://www.appdome.com/how-to/appsec-release-orchestration/code-signing-protected-android-ios/appdome-enabling-signing-secured-ios-apps-without-xcode/"))

## **How to Implement Obfuscate App Logic in Android Apps Using Appdome.**

On Appdome, follow these **3 simple steps** to create self-defending Android Apps that **Obfuscate App Logic**without an SDK or gateway:

1. Designate the mobile app to be protected.  
   1.1 Upload a mobile app via the Appdome Mobile Defense platform GUI or via Appdome’s DEV–API or CI/CD Plugins.  
   1.2 Android Formats: .apk or .aab  
   1.3 **Obfuscate App Logic** **is compatible with** Java, JS, C++, C#, Kotlin, Flutter, React Native, Unity, Xamarin, Cordova, and other Android apps.
2. Select the defense: **Obfuscate App Logic**  
   2.1. Create and name the Fusion Set (security template) that will contain the **Obfuscate App Logic** feature as shown below:

   ![Obfuscate App Logic Create Fs](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/Obfuscate-App-Logic-create-FS-650x145.png)

   Figure 1: Fusion Set that will contain the Prevent Logging Attacks feature  
   Note: Naming the Fusion Set to correspond to the protection(s) selected is for illustration purposes only (not required).  
   2.1.1 When you select the **Obfuscate App Logic**, you’ll notice that the Fusion Set you created in step 2.1 now bears the icon of the protection category that contains **Obfuscate App Logic**.

   ![Obfuscate App Logic Fs Applied](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/09/Obfuscate-App-Logic-FS-Applied-650x109.png)

   Figure 2: Fusion Set that displays the newly added **Obfuscate App Logic** protection.  
   Note: Annotating the Fusion Set to identify the protection(s) selected is optional only (not mandatory).

   2.1.2 Open the Fusion Set Detail Summary by clicking the “…” symbol on the far-right corner of the Fusion Set. Copy the Fusion Set ID from the Fusion Set Detail Summary (as shown below):

   ![fusion Set Detail Summary image](/wp-content/plugins/knowledge-base/assets/copy_fs_id.png)

   2.1.3 Follow the instructions below to use the Fusion Set ID inside any standard mobile DevOps or CI/CD toolkit like Bitrise, Jenkins, Travis, Team City, Circle CI, or other systems:  
   2.1.3.1 Refer to the [Appdome API Reference Guide](https://apis.appdome.com/reference/get_upload-link "https://apis.appdome.com/reference/get_upload-link") for API building instructions.  
   2.1.3.2 Check Appdome’s [GitHub Repository](https://github.com/Appdome/appdome-api-python "https://github.com/Appdome/appdome-api-python") for sample APIs.  
   2.2 Add Obfuscate App Logic  
   2.2.1 Navigate to **Build** > **Security** tab > **TOTALCode™ Obfuscation** section in the Appdome Console.  
   2.2.2 Enable **Obfuscate App Logic**  
   (a) Toggle On **Obfuscate App Logic**  
   Note: The checkmark feature **De-Obfuscate DataDog Crash Report** is enabled by default, as shown below.

   ![De Obfuscate Datadog Crash Report](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/De-Obfuscate-DataDog-Crash-Report.png)

   Figure 3: Selecting Obfuscate App Logic  
   Note: The Appdome platform displays the Mobile Operating System supported by each defense in real-time. For more details, see our [OS Support Policy](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/devsecops-automation-mobile-cicd/mobile-os-compatibility/appdome-support-policy-for-mobile-app-architectures-and-processors/ "https://www.appdome.com/how-to/devsecops-automation-mobile-cicd/mobile-os-compatibility/appdome-support-policy-for-mobile-app-architectures-and-processors/") KB.

   3. Initiate the build command either by clicking **Build My App** or via your CI/CD.

   ## How to Automatically De-Obfuscate DataDog Crash Reports

   1. Click on Workflow Summary:

   ![Workflow Summary](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/04/Screenshot-2024-04-08-at-17.17.03-1300x183.png)

   2. Click Download Obfuscation Mapping Files

   ![Download Obfuscation Mapping Files ](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/04/Screenshot-2024-04-08-at-17.17.30-1-e1712734271723.png)
3. Locate the required files. The downloaded zip file will be used with the DataDog API Key to upload the de-obfuscation mapping files to DataDog.  
   The zip file ‘deobfuscation\_mapping\_files.zip’ should look like this:  
   ![Datadog Mapping Files](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/DataDog-mapping-files-e1732789319502.png)
4. Get your DataDog API KEY. To extract the DataDog API key, use the following: <https://docs.datadoghq.com/account_management/api-app-keys/>
5. Run The following Python command from the [appdome-api-python:](https://github.com/Appdome/appdome-api-python)  
   ![Python Command](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/Python-command.png)  
   ![Appdome Python Command](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/Appdome-Python-command.png)
6. Install the protected APK app file on your device.  
   ![Install The Protected Apk App File On Your Device.](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/Install-the-protected-APK-app-file-on-your-device.png)
7. Produce a new crash report to verify that the de-obfuscation works.

From this point forward, every session, stack trace, and error in DataDog related to this Appdome build will be automatically de-obfuscated.

**After DataDog De-Obfuscation  
![De Obfuscated Mapping Files](https://www.appdome.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/10/De-obfuscated-Mapping-Files-e1730024459375.png)**
